turns.speaker: F
turns.content: The only one I know still love his parents.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Yeah, that kind of went out of style didn't it?

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Oh it's not bad thing it's good thing.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: You know it's nice here, the air is sweet.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: You're not sorry you came?

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Not sorry, no.  I can't stay here.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Why not?

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: For one thing your mother as much as told me to go.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Well.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: [BREATHING] And then you've been kind of...

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: What?

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: You've been kind of embarrassed ever since I got here.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I was kind of planning on sneaking up on you, you know over like a course of a week or so. They just take for granted that we're already set.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: I knew they would, your mother anyway.

vad_annotations.notes: more bitter than amused this time

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: You did?

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: From her point of view why else would I come?

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Yeah--

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: So then would you want to?  I mean I guess, you kind of have to know, maybe that's why I asked you to come.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Well I guess that's why I came.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Ann, I love you.  I love you.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I love you a great deal.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I'm sorry I don't really have much of an imagination.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Chris,

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I'm sorry I'm embarrassing you, aren't I?  See, I didn't want to do it here I didn't on this porch, with this ring--I didn't want to win you away from anything.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: I've been ready a long, long time.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: So then he's gone.  You sure?

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: I almost got married two years ago.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Why didn't you?

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: You started to write me.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: You felt something that far back?

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Everyday since.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: why didn't you let me know?

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Because I was waiting for you, Chris.  Till then you never wrote me and then when you did, well, you sure can be ambiguous you know.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Oh Annie, why don't you go ahead and give me a kiss, come on just a...

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I kissed you.  I kissed Annie.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: I'll never forgive you for waiting so long.  All I did was sit around and wonder if I was crazy for thinking about you.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I kissed you.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Like Larry's brother.  Do what like you, Chris.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Chris, what's the matter?

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Do you want to go somewhere?  Let's go.

vad_annotations.notes: distracted, tries to change subject, anxious

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: No, what is it?  Is your mother?

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: No, no, it's nothing like that.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Well, then what?  You know, even in your letter you seem kind of ashamed.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I don't know it's--it's complicated. But it's going from me now.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: You got to tell me.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I don't know.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: It's kind of all mixed up with all these other things.

vad_annotations.notes: tries to explain without explaining, so sad

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Wouldn't work like this.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: you know over seas I was in command of the company?

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Well I lost them.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: How many?

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Pretty much all.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: [BREATHING]. Geez.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Takes awhile to toss something like that off.  I mean they weren't just men, you know.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: For instance, there was this one time when this kid--it had been raining for like several days and he gave me his last pair of dry socks.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: He just put it in my pocket that's the kind of guys I had.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: They didn't die they killed themselves for each other and I mean that exactly, you know a little more selfish and they'll all be here today...

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: And I had this idea as I was watching them go down like everything was being destroyed, you know.  But I felt like this one new thing was being made, you know it's kind of like this.  This monument...

vad_annotations.notes: on the verge of tears, traumatized, disillusioned

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: You know, that they were bringing something on to this earth, a kind of sacrifice you know.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I thought I would change everything you know, and I got back here and it was- it was like nothing had changed at all...

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: You know.  I went to work with dad and I started that whole rat race again...

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: And no one had changed it was just like sort of random bus accident to them.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Driving my new car and I felt guilty you know opening my bank book seeing a new refrigerator.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: 'Cause you can take those things out of a war.  But you have to realize that those things came out of the love that a man can have for another man...

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: And if you can't see that then it's just loot and there's blood all over it.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I felt ashamed and I didn't want any part of it.  I guess I included you too.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Do you still feel that way?

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I want you to know Annie.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: 'Cause you mustn't feel that way.  Everything you have, you have a right to...

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: Everything Chris do you understand that?  To me too...

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: And your money there's nothing wrong in your money.  Your father put hundreds of planes into the air.  You should be proud of that a man should be paid for that.

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: Annie...

turns.speaker: M
turns.content: I'm going to make a fortune for you.

turns.speaker: F
turns.content: What would I do with a fortune?
